snippet: Deadly coal mining disasters are nothing new to West Virginia, but a 2010 explosion is different in one important respect: A chief executive is being charged over the 29 lives lost.
abstract: Indictment of Massey Energy chief executive Donald L Blankenship over 29 deaths in Upper Big Branch mine disaster marks turning point in long history of de facto criminal immunity for coal barons; legal experts note that mine managers have been protected by politicians, courts and their economic influence for more than a century in the coal country of West Virgina.
lead_paragraph: Deadly coal mining disasters are nothing new to West Virginia, but a 2010 explosion is different in one important respect: A chief executive is being charged over the 29 lives lost.

headline.main: West Virginia Coal Country Sees New Era as Donald Blankenship Is Indicted
headline.print_headline: Mine Boss Indicted, Coal Country Sees New Era
